name: analyze-cell-migration-metrics
title: Analyze Cell Migration Metrics
description: Analyze cell migration metrics from time-lapse microscopy images
content:
Overview

This application analyzes cell migration metrics from time-lapse microscopy images. Built using Biomni, it tracks cells over time and calculates migration metrics including speed, directionality, and displacement.

Features

  • Cell detection and tracking across time-lapse sequences
  • Calculates migration speed, directionality ratio, and displacement
  • Generates trajectory visualizations and rose plots
  • Exports detailed metrics and summary statistics

Parameters

  • Image Sequence Path: Directory of time-lapse images or multi-frame TIFF file
  • Pixel Size (μm): Conversion factor from pixels to micrometers
  • Time Interval (min): Time between consecutive frames in minutes
  • Min Track Length: Minimum frames a cell must be tracked
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates CSV files with migration metrics, trajectory data, and PNG visualizations including trajectories and directional rose plots.

Use Cases

  • Cell motility studies
  • Wound healing assays
  • Cancer cell migration analysis
  • Drug screening for migration inhibitors
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/bioengineering/analyze_cell_migration_metrics.py" "${imageSequencePath}" --pixel-size-um ${pixelSizeUm} --time-interval-min ${timeIntervalMin} --min-track-length ${minTrackLength} -o "${outputDir}"
